channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

  • Description: ABF stated when they were moving freight out of the trailer they noticed all 6 totes have spillage on the top of the tote around the seal due to splashing in transit.

item.title: Report E-2024040152
item.description:
Report E-2024040152

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: TOMAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XTM contacted ERTS regarding a punctured leaking tote containing Predator MR2516. The tote was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 35-gallons of product onto the wooden trailer floor and concrete underneath the trailer. The trailer floor impact area was 18'x18' and the impact area underneath the trailer was 8'x20'. A Contractor performed a tote transfer, cut-up pallets that were impacted by the release, and cleaned-up the release on the trailer floor. Five drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.
